pageContext.description: Early Bronze Age Flanged axe, straight sides slightly convex in section, sub-rectangular heel, blade expanding towards damaged crescentic cutting edge, original edge missing, cast flanges, slight transverse bevel ridge on both faces at junction of hafting surface and blade below which is a broad band of multiple short vertical grooves. Heavily corroded with much of the surface missing at both ends and pitting and blistering occurring over all surfaces. Surviving length 93mm. Surviving width at blade 45mm. Thickness at mid-point of flange 11.5mm. Weight 162.83g. Cast flanged axes belong to the later part of the Early Bronze Age. c.1700 - c.1500 BC.
